meanings.definition: The state of feeling nauseous or uneasy.
meanings.sent1: Her queasinesses after the roller coaster ride made her pale.
meanings.sent2: The queasinesses in his stomach disappeared after he ate a light meal.
meanings.sent3: The queasinesses she felt before the exam made her forget all her notes.
meanings.sent4: The queasinesses of uncertainty gnawed at his mind like a persistent itch.
meanings.sent5: The queasinesses of seasickness overwhelmed him as the boat rocked violently.

meanings.definition: A feeling of discomfort or unease.
meanings.sent1: The queasinesses in the room grew as the tension mounted.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't shake off the queasinesses in her gut before the big presentation.
meanings.sent3: The queasinesses of embarrassment flushed her cheeks bright red.
meanings.sent4: The queasinesses of doubt clouded his judgment in making decisions.
meanings.sent5: The queasinesses of homesickness tugged at her heartstrings as she looked at old photos.

meanings.definition: The quality of causing discomfort or unease.
meanings.sent1: The horror movie had a queasinesses that lingered long after it ended.
meanings.sent2: The queasinesses of the eerie silence in the abandoned house sent shivers down her spine.
meanings.sent3: The queasinesses of the bitter medicine made her cringe before swallowing.
meanings.sent4: The queasinesses of the dark alley made her walk faster to reach safety.
meanings.sent5: The queasinesses of the haunted house made her hairs stand on end as she entered.
